attributes.comment:
To: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services Re: Docket USCIS-2006- 0044
Please do not increase the fees for USCIS services required for couples to adopt
children. Most couples have already spent a great deal of money on medical
expenses to try and have biological children. For many couples adoption is the
only way to have their own children. It is a difficult and emotional process, as well
as very expensive. By wrongly increasing fees for the USCIS services many
couples may not be able to pursue adoption. This is a terrible thing to know that
someone who wants a family of their own could not have one because the
government charges too much for necessary documents. The emotional distress
these increases will put on couples trying to adopt could potentially increase the
health care cost for mental, emotional and physical stress. By making it easier
and less expensive both private and government funds could be saved.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by C. Geske
